meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Ira Levine Lance King Linda Shewey Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #624.

td.p: Ira Levine, a banker from Studio City, California
Lance King, a teacher originally from Buffalo, New York
Linda Shewey, a housewife from Richmond, Virginia (whose 1-day cash winnings total $8,000)

tr.td: FOOTBALL
FRANCE
THE INSTRUMENT PLAYED
NURSERY RHYMES
DOGS
THE JET SET

tr.td: Linda
Lance
Ira
19TH CENTURY AMERICA
[The TH was underlined and half the size of the 19.]
SHAKESPEARE ON BROADWAY
"FORT"s
BUSINESS BIGGIES
WINE
ADD A LETTER
(Alex: We're going to need two words in your responses.)

')
div.onmouseout:
toggle('clue_DJ_3_2', 'clue_DJ_3_2_stuck', '[AUDIO DAILY DOUBLE] Home of TV cavalry unit whose theme was the following: "His medal of honor pleased and thrilled
his proud little family group/While pinning it on some blood was spilled/And so it was planned he\'d command F Troop/Where Indian fights are colorful sights and nobody takes a lickin\'"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td:
[AUDIO DAILY DOUBLE] Home of TV cavalry unit whose theme was the following: "His medal of honor pleased and thrilled
his proud little family group/While pinning it on some blood was spilled/And so it was planned he'd command F Troop/Where Indian fights are colorful sights and nobody takes a lickin'"

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: Did she [Linda] get the right disease? It sounds strange to say that, doesn\'t it? Did you get the right disease? You did! You got [*]. Aren\'t you lucky!)
[Laughter]
IraWhat is small pox
$400
LindaWhat is small pox?
$3,000
LanceWhat is leprosy?
$3,000
smallpox')

tr.td: MEDICINE
In 1977, the world's last naturally-occurring case of this disease occurred in Somalia
Linda
Lance
Ira
2-day champion: $14,200
3rd place: Maytag washer & dryer
2nd place: trip on Eastern to Atlanta & stay at Viscount Hotel

Lance
Ira

(including 1 DD),
